Thank you for your service Sen. Flake.

I want to thank Jeff Flake for representing Arizona in the House and Senate for nearly two decades. Jeff was a voice for fiscal responsibility at the federal level before it was popular, and effectively ended the practice of earmarks. I’ve appreciated his friendship, professionalism and intellect on policy issues impacting Arizona. I wish all the best for Jeff, Cheryl and their whole family.

recommendations: Michelle Bart
Media Consultant / Publicist / Producer / Child Advocate
August 12, 2008, Michelle worked with Neil but at different companies

Neil has been without a doubt a productive leader that continues to strive to make GLAAD an organization that the LGBT community can be proud to be a part of!  Neil's leadership, compassion, professionalism, and knack of knowing his donors by name make any organization envy to have Neil part of their team!  We're very honored to be associated with Neil and his team at GLAAD!

Ryan Ubuntu Olson, MPS
Senior Associate at Palladium Group
May 26, 2012, Neil was Ryan Ubuntu’s mentor

Bright, passionate, creative, hard-working, problem-solving and visionary are all characteristics I would use to describe Ryan. Give Ryan a new, bold and ambitious project and let him work with or lead a group of like-minded people and it will come to fruition. With a solid knowledge base, strong interpersonal skills and a good understanding of his own place in the world, Ryan is poised to make great things happen.

Peter Caborn
Associate Vice President for Alumni Affairs & Advancement Services at Wayne State University
October 17, 2011, Neil was senior to Peter but didn’t manage directly

Peter is a top notch, successful development professional who understands philanthropy at the strategic and tactical levels. He knows the importance of, and has experience with, prospect identification, cultivation, engagement, building long-term relationships/listening, ongoing recognition and closing significant gifts.He is detail oriented, has great follow-through and his interpersonal skills build trust with colleagues and, most importantly, donors. Given the right opportunity for his career advancement, I would not hesitate to include Peter on my development team.

summary: GPL aligns the CEO leadership of the region at the intersection of the business/gov't/philanthropy and education sectors.Expertise in leadership for complex organizations: public, private and social impact sectors, personal leadership development, corporate responsibility, diversity and inclusion.Mission: live impactful with purpose and intent.
